{ "step_by_step_thinking": "A pulpectomy is a procedure to save a severely damaged or decayed tooth, typically performed on primary teeth. Let's analyze the options: A. Primary teeth with sinus tract - Pulpectomy can be performed as it's a sign of infection. B. Primary teeth without successor - Pulpectomy can be performed to maintain the space for the permanent tooth, even if it's missing. C. Primary teeth with furcation pathology - Pulpectomy can be performed as it's a sign of severe infection. D. Pulpless primary teeth next to the line of a palatal cleft - Pulpectomy is not performed on pulpless teeth as there is no pulp tissue to remove or treat.", "answer_choice": "D" }
